terms.term: In computer science, a Honeypot is some form of system or software that appears to be a legitimate target for unauthorized access and theft of data, but instead is isolated, heavily monitored, and is sometimes even capable of blocking or analyzing threats as they come. Examples of these types of software are owa-honeypot or cowrie.

An instruction or set of instructions that will be processed when a Honeypot is broken. These can include ban, kick, notification to staff, warning to the player, server-wide broadcasts, custom commands, or even custom Behaviors added by developers in other plugins that integrate with Honeypot.
A custom action that has been registered in Honeypot via a 3rd party plugin.
A plugin that provides a behavior or behaviors
A custom block storage mechanism registered in Honeypot via a 3rd party plugin
A plugin that can manage Honeypot's block storage via a provided Store.
A piece of code that detects and responds to events triggered by a program or software, such as Paper.
